data.title: Outstanding Rhones!
data.text: Margerum is perhaps the best Rhone Wine producer in the Santa Barbara region, maybe even the world. The tasting room is friendly and organized with an excellent selection of wines. Margerum syrah and the M5 blend are always winners. Parking is challenging and there are a lot of other tasting rooms in the area.

data.title: Friendly tasting
data.text:
Not a huge range of wines in the tasting, but the team were friendly and knowledgeable. 

We went as a couple but they allowed us to share one tasting, which is a great tip to make it much more cost effective.

data.title: Old Town Charm
data.text: Margerum Wine Company is located in the El Paseo Historic shopping area. Whether you drink wine or not it's worth a visit to see this lovely Paseo. Margerum Wine Company has an excellent variety of wines with a lovely top rated restaurant right next door. There are other wineries located in the El Paseo area. Have fun sipping.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: The owner Doug Margerum is supposed to be one of the leaders of Santa Barbara area wine making but i found the wines not very good or interesting.  There are better choices around the town.

data.title: Enjoyable wine tasting experience
data.text: We were in town on a weekend and almost blew it by goofing off too much in the hotel in the afternoon; the tasting places close at 6 and you need to be there at 5:30 for the 'last call'. We got to Margerum a little after that but they were very welcoming. Fine wines, nice conversation, enjoyable experience.

data.title: Downtown Santa Barbara Wine Tasting
data.text: Excellent location and a great little tasting room.  They were attentive and very knowledgable.  Wines were excellent.

data.title: Great tasting!
data.text: Enjoyed ourselves tremendously at a recent library tasting in Buellton.  The Margerum family and whole staff were wonderful and we came away with some great library wines.

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: We had a really great experience here and were treated graciously during our wine tasting! We would highly recommend the reserve tasting room!

data.title: Great Wine Tasting Experience in Downtown Santa Barbara
data.text: First and foremost, Margerum puts out great wines. Excellent in every varietal.  Second, I prefer this location for winetasting in the Santa Barbara area.  Even though it is located in the heart of the downtown area, the tasting room is on the back side of the Santa Barbara's main street, State.  It is away from the busy shopping areas and sandwiched between two top eating establishments.

data.title: Great little tasting room.
data.text: My sister and I happened upon the Margerum tasting room while exploring Santa Barbara. The ladies at the tasting were friendly and knowledgeable, and the wines were excellent. We'll definitely be back!

data.title: wine tasting
data.text: wonderful experience, lovely atmosphere, were fortunate to have a wedding going on with a mariachi band  at the time we were there . Wines were excellent and free flowing

data.title: Terrible wines and rude and unknowledgeable staff
data.text: I visited Margerum on a Friday after a (lovely) afternoon wine tasting in SLO. The guy who helped us at Margerum was incredibly rude (literally complaining about our presence to us) and knew nothing about the wines. The wines themselves were laughably bad - the reisling tasted like a green apple jolly rancher - yuck! Everyone in our party was disappointed by the wine quality. The amaro was even worse. When I paid my tasting fee (which was $10 and they didn't even give me the full tasting flight, but still charged me fully) the receipt printer was apparently not working so I provided my email address for a receipt (in a Square-like app). I did not sign up for emails or give permission to use my email address for promotional purposes whatsoever. I have since received several emails from Margerum - and have "unsubscribed" each time (which has done NOTHING). I wasn't going to write a review, I was going to just try to forget the terrible experience but I just received another email from Margerum - this time asking me to review them on TripAdvisor... Well here you go. I strongly recommend against visiting Margerum.

owner_response.author: Doug M, Owner at Margerum Wine Company, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Kate,

I am sorry you had such a bad experience at our tasting room and have had issues with the unsubscribe.  If you continue to receive emails, please let hugh@margerumwines.com know.  He will investigate the issue.  We strive to ensure that all staff is trained and knowledgeable about our wines and make our guests feel welcome.

As for the wine quality, its unfortunate they were not agreeable with your pallet.  

Thanks
Brooks

data.title: Great wine, interesting conversation!
data.text: Enjoyed wine tasting at Margerum's tasting room in the historic El Paseo twice in the last month. Go!

data.title: Good looking tasting room and wonderful host!
data.text: I came in to buy their Sauvignon Blanc specifically.  The host, Rani, was wonderful!  I'm from Santa Barbara and I bought this wine for my clients to enjoy.  Margerum Sauvignon Blanc is one of the best tasting white wines I've had.

data.title: Terrific Wines and Tasting Room
data.text: Visited the Margerum Wine Company tasting room with friends on a recent visit to Santa Barbara.  We visited during mid week so we did not have to contend with large groups.  We chose to visit the room serving reserve wines hosted by one of the founding brothers.  Very informative and engaging presentation.  All of the wines in the tasting flight were outstanding.  Full, rich, big red wines. Couldn't resist their amazing Syrah.  Margerum is located in a beautiful cluster of wine tasting rooms and lovely restaurant just off State Street in the heart of the business district.  We found the wines, venue, and food to be more upscale (for the most part) than those located closer to the water.

data.title: Smart tasting Room with excellent wines and staff.
data.text: Walking into the tasting room, it was obvious from the start that this is one serious vineyard tasting room.  The three of us had great conversations about the bouquet, colors and tastes of the wine and the pourer was most knowledgable and guided our tastes to appropriate wines. We purchased wines and joined the wine club as well.

data.title: Shopping for a good bottle of Merlot
data.text: The lady that helped me was great she new her wine and she was very friendly and professional.We talked about all kinds of different types of wines.

data.title: good wine tasting in downtown SBA
data.text: After a friend had introduced me to the excellent wined Margerum makes, it was great to visit the tasting room in downtown Santa Barbara. Nice room, friendly service and learned a lot about the wines they poured that day, and ended up tasting some other ones as well. Nice experience!

data.title: Great Little Tasting Room
data.text: The women who worked there were great and very knowledgeable. We felt very comfortable, as we are not wine connoisseurs but just enjoy a nice bottle as a treat. The room was pretty and the back let to a little garden and other tasting rooms. The lovely women working there were even kind enough to recommend other tasting rooms after we left which we loved. We brought back two bottles and have enjoyed one and are saving the other for a special occasion!

data.title: Good taste!
data.text: We went to an organised wine tasting event in January 2016. Excellent range of well priced wines, good food & great atmosphere.
